name: General Data Protection Regulation
description: EU-wide data protection and privacy regulation governing processing of personal data of individuals in the EEA. Rackspace Technology acts as data processor under GDPR for customer data hosted in EU data centers. Data Processing Addendum with Standard Contractual Clauses incorporated in Master Services Agreement. Source: rackspace.com/gdpr, 10-K FY2024.

name: Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002
description: US federal statute requiring public companies to maintain internal controls over financial reporting with CEO/CFO certification. Rackspace Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ: RXT, CIK 0001810019) is Delaware-incorporated and NASDAQ-listed, subject to SOX Sections 302/404. Source: SEC EDGAR, S-1 filing, 10-K FY2024.

name: Securities Exchange Act of 1934 Reporting Requirements
description: US federal statute Sections 13/15(d) requiring public companies to file periodic reports (10-K, 10-Q, 8-K, proxy statements) with the SEC. Rackspace Technology subject as NASDAQ-listed registrant. Source: SEC EDGAR, 10-K FY2024.

name: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act
description: US federal statute establishing national standards for protection of electronic protected health information (ePHI). Rackspace Technology provides HIPAA-compliant hosting environments as a business associate with BAA support across dedicated and cloud hosting. Source: rackspace.com/compliance, Carahsoft listing, 10-K FY2024.

name: Federal Information Security Modernization Act of 2014
description: US federal statute requiring federal agencies and their service providers to develop, document, and implement information security programs. Rackspace Technology holds FISMA High authorization via FedRAMP baseline. Source: 10-K FY2024, rackspace.com/compliance/fedramp.

name: International Traffic in Arms Regulations
description: US State Department regulations (codified 22 CFR 120-130) controlling export, import, and brokering of defense articles and technical data on the US Munitions List. Rackspace Government Solutions provides ITAR-compliant hosting within US-only environments. Source: Carahsoft listing, rackspace.com/compliance/fedramp.

name: UK Data Protection Act 2018 / UK GDPR
description: UK domestic implementation of GDPR principles post-Brexit via European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018 and Data Protection Act 2018. Governs processing of personal data by UK-operating organizations. Applicable to Rackspace Limited (Co# 03897010) and UK data center infrastructure. Source: rackspace.com/gdpr, ICO guidance.

name: NIS2 Directive
description: EU directive (2022/2555) strengthening cybersecurity requirements for essential and important entities across 18 sectors including digital infrastructure and managed service providers. Requires risk management, incident reporting within 24 hours, management accountability. Applicable to Rackspace as digital infrastructure/MSP provider in EU. Member state transposition deadline October 17, 2024. Source: Directive (EU) 2022/2555, operational footprint analysis.

name: Digital Operational Resilience Act
description: EU regulation (2022/2554) establishing ICT risk management, incident reporting, resilience testing, and third-party oversight for financial entities and their critical ICT service providers. Applicable to Rackspace as ICT third-party service provider to EU financial sector customers. Source: Regulation (EU) 2022/2554, customer base analysis.

name: EU Artificial Intelligence Act
description: First comprehensive AI regulation (2024/1689) establishing risk-based framework with mandatory requirements for high-risk AI systems including risk management, data governance, transparency, and human oversight. Applicable to Rackspace as provider of AI services (Rackspace AI Anywhere) in EU market. Source: Regulation (EU) 2024/1689.

name: China Personal Information Protection Law
description: Comprehensive data privacy law governing processing of personal information of individuals in China with strict cross-border transfer and data localization requirements. Applicable to Rackspace via Shanghai data center (SHA3). Source: PIPL enacted August 20, 2021, site-045 operational presence.

name: China Cybersecurity Law
description: Chinese law establishing cybersecurity requirements including data localization, network security obligations, and critical information infrastructure protection for operators in mainland China. Source: CSL enacted November 7, 2016, site-045 operational presence.

name: India Digital Personal Data Protection Act 2023
description: India's comprehensive digital privacy law establishing consent-driven, rights-based framework for digital personal data. Draft Rules published January 2025 by MeitY. Applicable to Rackspace via major delivery centers in Gurgaon (site-009), Hyderabad (site-010), and Bangalore (site-011). Source: DPDP Act 2023, MeitY Draft Rules 2025.

name: Singapore Personal Data Protection Act
description: Singapore data protection law governing collection, use, disclosure, and care of personal data. Applicable to Rackspace via Singapore APAC office (site-008, Just Analytics acquisition Jan 2022). Source: PDPA 2012, amended 2020.

name: Texas Identity Theft Enforcement and Protection Act
description: Texas breach notification statute (Bus. & Com. Code §521) requiring notification within 60 days of breach discovery, AG notification within 30 days if 250+ Texans affected. Civil penalties $2,000-$50,000 per violation, up to $250,000 for failure to notify. Rackspace HQ in San Antonio (site-001). Source: Tex. Bus. & Com. Code Ann. §521.001 et seq., Texas AG.

name: Texas Data Privacy and Security Act
description: Texas comprehensive consumer privacy law granting residents rights to access, correct, delete, and opt out of data processing/sale. Enforced by Texas AG with $7,500 per violation penalties. 30-day cure period. Applicable to Rackspace given Texas HQ and operations. Source: TDPSA effective July 1, 2024.

name: California Consumer Privacy Act / California Privacy Rights Act
description: California comprehensive privacy law granting consumers rights to know, delete, opt-out of sale/sharing, and limit use of sensitive personal information. Enforced by CPPA and California AG. Applicable to Rackspace given California data center operations (site-026 SJC3, site-027 SFO) and California-resident customer/employee data processing. Source: Cal. Civ. Code §1798.100 et seq.

name: Virginia Consumer Data Protection Act
description: Virginia comprehensive consumer data protection law effective January 1, 2023. Applicable to Rackspace given significant Virginia operational presence (site-002 Reston, site-023/024/025 Ashburn/Herndon DCs). Source: Va. Code Ann. §59.1-575 et seq.

name: Delaware Personal Data Privacy Act
description: Delaware comprehensive privacy law effective January 1, 2025. Rackspace Technology, Inc. incorporated in Delaware. Applies to businesses processing personal data of 35,000+ Delaware consumers or 10,000+ consumers with revenue from data sales. Source: Del. Code Ann. tit. 6, ch. 12D.

name: Illinois Biometric Information Privacy Act
description: Illinois statute regulating collection, use, storage, and destruction of biometric identifiers and information. Private right of action with $1,000-$5,000 per violation statutory damages. Applicable to Rackspace given Chicago DC operations (site-028 ORD1) and potential employee/visitor biometric data collection. Source: 740 ILCS 14.

name: Oregon Consumer Privacy Act
description: Oregon comprehensive privacy law effective July 1, 2024. Unique expanded definition of personal data including derived data. GLBA/HIPAA exemptions narrowly scope covered data, not entities. Applicable to Rackspace given Oregon DC presence (site-033 Hillsboro). Source: Or. Rev. Stat. §646A.

name: New Jersey Data Privacy Act
description: New Jersey comprehensive privacy law effective January 15, 2025. Applies to controllers processing data of 100,000+ NJ consumers or 25,000+ with revenue from data sales. Applicable to Rackspace given NJ DC operations (site-030/031 NYC1/NYC2 Somerset). Source: N.J.S.A. 56:8-166.1 et seq.

name: Washington My Health My Data Act
description: Washington state health data privacy law extending protections beyond HIPAA to consumer health data held by non-HIPAA-covered entities. Geofencing provisions. Private right of action. Applicable to Rackspace given Washington DC operations (site-032 Tukwila). Source: RCW 19.373.

name: Massachusetts Data Security Regulation
description: Massachusetts regulation (201 CMR 17.00) requiring comprehensive written information security programs with specific technical safeguards for personal information of MA residents. Considered benchmark for state data security. Applicable to Rackspace given MA-resident customer/employee data. Source: 201 CMR 17.00.

name: Georgia Personal Identity Protection Act
description: Georgia breach notification statute requiring notification to affected individuals and AG for breaches involving personal information. Applicable to Rackspace given Atlanta DC operations (site-035). Source: O.C.G.A. §10-1-912.

name: Pennsylvania Breach of Personal Information Notification Act
description: Pennsylvania breach notification statute requiring notification without unreasonable delay. Applicable to Rackspace given PA-resident data processing from operational footprint. Source: 73 P.S. §2303.

name: Australia Privacy Act 1988 / Notifiable Data Breaches Scheme
description: Australian federal privacy legislation governing handling of personal information by organizations with AU$3M+ annual turnover. NDB scheme requires notification to OAIC and affected individuals for eligible data breaches. Applicable to Rackspace via AU offices (site-006/007) and Sydney DC (site-042). Source: Privacy Act 1988 (Cth), NDB Amendment 2017.

name: Canada Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act
description: Canadian federal privacy law governing collection, use, and disclosure of personal information in commercial activities. Applicable to Rackspace via Toronto sales office (site-013) and Canadian customer operations. Source: PIPEDA S.C. 2000, c.5.

name: Brazil Lei Geral de Proteção de Dados
description: Brazilian comprehensive data protection law modeled on GDPR. Extraterritorial applicability to entities processing data of individuals in Brazil regardless of location. Applicable to Rackspace if processing data of Brazilian residents through global operations. Source: LGPD Law No. 13,709/2018.

name: Malaysia Personal Data Protection Act 2010
description: Malaysian data protection law governing processing of personal data in commercial transactions. Applicable to Rackspace via Petaling Jaya delivery center (site-016). Source: PDPA 2010 (Act 709).

name: Germany Federal Data Protection Act (Bundesdatenschutzgesetz)
description: German federal data protection law supplementing GDPR with national-specific provisions including employee data protection and federal data protection commissioner authority. Applicable to Rackspace via Hamburg office (site-005) and Frankfurt DCs (site-039/040). Source: BDSG 2018.

name: UAE Personal Data Protection Law
description: UAE federal data protection law (Decree-Law No. 45/2021) governing processing of personal data with cross-border transfer restrictions. Applicable to Rackspace via Dubai sales office (site-012). Source: UAE PDPL 2021.

name: SEC Cybersecurity Risk Management and Incident Disclosure Rule
description: SEC final rule (July 26, 2023) requiring public companies to disclose material cybersecurity incidents on Form 8-K Item 1.05 within four business days of materiality determination, plus annual 10-K disclosures on cybersecurity risk management, strategy, and governance (Reg S-K Item 106). Rackspace directly subject as SEC registrant. Source: SEC Release Nos. 33-11216; 34-97989, effective December 18, 2023.

name: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program
description: US government-wide standardized approach to security assessment, authorization, and continuous monitoring for cloud products and services. Rackspace Government Solutions holds FedRAMP JAB Moderate authorization with 23 FedRAMP ATOs. One of only 36 JAB-authorized solutions. Source: rackspace.com/compliance/fedramp, Carahsoft listing.

name: DoD Cloud Computing Security Requirements Guide IL2/IL4
description: DoD security framework establishing cloud computing security requirements at multiple impact levels. Rackspace Government Solutions holds DoD SRG IL2 and IL4 authorization. Source: Carahsoft listing, rackspace.com/compliance/fedramp.

name: Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification
description: DoD certification framework establishing unified cybersecurity standards for defense industrial base. Three levels with increasing requirements. Rackspace is CMMC Registered Provider Organization (RPO). Source: Carahsoft listing, rackspace.com/solve/what-know-about-cmmc, 32 CFR Part 170.

name: DFARS 252.204-7012 / NIST SP 800-171
description: DFARS clause requiring defense contractors to implement NIST SP 800-171 110 security requirements across 14 control families for CUI protection. Rackspace Government Solutions is DFARS-authorized and NIST 800-171 DFARS-ready. Source: Carahsoft listing.

name: NIST SP 800-53 Security and Privacy Controls
description: NIST catalog of security and privacy controls for federal information systems. FedRAMP Moderate baseline derived from 800-53. Rackspace implements NIST 800-53 Moderate as part of FedRAMP authorization. Source: Carahsoft listing, rackspace.com/compliance/fedramp.

name: FIPS 140-2 Cryptographic Module Validation
description: US/Canada federal standard specifying security requirements for cryptographic modules. Required for federal workloads. Rackspace Government Solutions is FIPS 140-2 compliant. Source: Carahsoft listing.

name: Criminal Justice Information Services Security Policy
description: FBI security policy establishing minimum requirements for access to Criminal Justice Information. Rackspace Government Solutions is CJIS compliant. Source: Carahsoft listing.

name: IRS Publication 1075 Tax Information Security Guidelines
description: IRS guidelines establishing minimum security standards for agencies receiving Federal Tax Information (FTI). Rackspace Government Solutions is IRS 1075 compliant. Source: Carahsoft listing.

name: Information Security Registered Assessors Program
description: Australian Signals Directorate program providing ICT security assessment against the Information Security Manual. Rackspace DHE added to ACSC Certified Cloud Services List for Unclassified DLM workloads. Sydney data halls assessed. Source: rackspace.com/en-au/newsroom IRAP announcement, 10-K FY2024.

name: Public Services Network Compliance
description: UK Government high-performance network standard requiring NCSC-accredited CHECK testing. Rackspace Government Cloud Central achieved PSN Service Provider accreditation. Source: rackspace.com/blog/rackspace-technology-psn-accreditation-uk-2021.

name: Cyber Incident Reporting for Critical Infrastructure Act
description: US federal law requiring critical infrastructure entities to report substantial cyber incidents to CISA within 72 hours and ransomware payments within 24 hours. Final rule expected early 2026. Applicable to Rackspace as critical digital infrastructure provider. Source: CIRCIA (Pub. L. 117-103), CISA rulemaking.

name: HIPAA Security Rule / Breach Notification Rule
description: HHS regulatory implementation of HIPAA establishing administrative, physical, and technical safeguards for ePHI and breach notification requirements for covered entities and business associates. Rackspace operates as business associate. Source: 45 CFR Parts 160, 162, 164.

name: PCI DSS v4.0
description: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard governing organizations that store, process, or transmit cardholder data. Rackspace holds PCI DSS Level 1 service provider certification (highest level) for US, UK, Hong Kong, and Australia facilities. Source: rackspace.com/compliance/pci, 10-K FY2024.

name: ISO/IEC 27001 Information Security Management
description: International standard for ISMS. Rackspace holds ISO 27001 certification (cert IS 636168) covering all global data center locations. External assessment with full reassessment every three years. Source: rackspace.com/compliance/iso, 10-K FY2024.

name: SOC 1 / SOC 2 / SOC 3 Attestation
description: AICPA Service Organization Control reports under SSAE standards. SOC 1 covers financial reporting controls; SOC 2 Type II covers security, availability, privacy, confidentiality, integrity; SOC 3 is public general-use report. Rackspace maintains all three attestations. Source: rackspace.com/compliance/soc, 10-K FY2024.

name: HITRUST Common Security Framework
description: Healthcare-focused certifiable security framework incorporating controls from HIPAA, HITECH, PCI DSS, COBIT, NIST, ISO. Rackspace holds HITRUST CSF certification covering all global data centers, validated against 300+ requirements across 19 security categories. Source: rackspace.com/compliance/hitrust, 10-K FY2024.

name: EU-US Data Privacy Framework
description: Transatlantic data transfer mechanism replacing invalidated EU-US Privacy Shield. Enables certified US organizations to receive personal data from EU/EEA. Rackspace utilizes SCCs and DPF for lawful cross-border transfers. Source: rackspace.com/gdpr, EC adequacy decision July 10, 2023.

name: ISO 14001 Environmental Management System
description: International standard for environmental management. Rackspace holds ISO 14001 certification (cert EMS 581182) for data centers and offices in Australia and UK. Externally assessed by BSI. Source: rackspace.com/compliance/iso.

name: ISO 9001 Quality Management System
description: International quality management standard. Rackspace UK management, delivery, and support functions certified to ISO 9001. Source: rackspace.com/compliance/iso.

name: ISO 45001 Occupational Health and Safety
description: International OH&S management standard. Rackspace holds ISO 45001 certification (cert OHS 587454). Source: rackspace.com/compliance/iso.

name: NIST Cybersecurity Framework
description: Voluntary framework of cybersecurity standards, guidelines, and best practices published by NIST. Widely adopted as baseline for enterprise cybersecurity programs. CSF 2.0 released February 2024. Applicable to Rackspace as industry-standard governance baseline underpinning customer trust. Source: NIST CSF 2.0.

name: CIS Critical Security Controls
description: Prioritized set of cybersecurity best practices (18 controls) published by Center for Internet Security. Widely adopted by managed service providers and referenced in multiple regulatory frameworks. Applicable to Rackspace as operational security baseline. Source: CIS Controls v8.

name: CSA STAR / Cloud Controls Matrix
description: Cloud Security Alliance Security Trust Assurance and Risk program providing cloud-specific security assurance framework. CCM maps to ISO 27001, SOC 2, PCI DSS, and FedRAMP. Applicable to Rackspace as multicloud managed service provider. Source: CSA CCM v4.

name: ISO/IEC 27017 Cloud Security Controls
description: International standard providing cloud-specific guidance for information security controls extending ISO 27002. Provides implementation guidance for both CSPs and cloud customers. Applicable to Rackspace as multicloud service provider. Source: ISO/IEC 27017:2015.

name: ISO/IEC 27018 PII Protection in Public Cloud
description: International standard establishing commonly accepted control objectives and guidelines for protecting PII in cloud computing environments. Applicable to Rackspace as cloud service provider processing customer PII. Source: ISO/IEC 27018:2019.

name: ISO/IEC 27701 Privacy Information Management System
description: International standard extending ISO 27001/27002 for privacy information management. Provides framework for PII controllers and processors. Applicable to Rackspace as data processor handling customer PII globally. Source: ISO/IEC 27701:2019.

name: Foreign Corrupt Practices Act
description: US federal statute (15 U.S.C. §78dd) prohibiting bribery of foreign government officials and requiring accurate books and records for SEC registrants. Anti-bribery provisions apply to all US persons and SEC registrants. Accounting provisions (Section 13(b)) require internal controls over financial reporting. Applicable to Rackspace as NASDAQ-listed registrant with operations in 15+ countries including India, UAE, Malaysia, Germany, Australia, Singapore, UK. Source: 15 U.S.C. §78dd-1 et seq., 10-K FY2024 global operations.

name: UK Bribery Act 2010
description: UK statute establishing offences of bribing, being bribed, bribery of foreign public officials, and failure of commercial organisations to prevent bribery. Section 7 corporate offence of failing to prevent bribery has strict liability with 'adequate procedures' defence. Applicable to Rackspace Limited (Co# 03897010) and any UK-connected commercial organisation. Source: UK Bribery Act 2010 c.23, Rackspace UK operations.

name: Bank Secrecy Act / OFAC Sanctions Regulations
description: US federal anti-money laundering statute (31 U.S.C. §5311 et seq.) and OFAC sanctions regulations (31 CFR Part 500) prohibiting transactions with sanctioned persons, entities, and countries. Rackspace AUP explicitly prohibits services for entities involved in terrorism, narcotics trafficking, arms trafficking, or sanctions violations. Source: 31 U.S.C. §5311, 31 CFR Part 500, rackspace.com/en-nl/information/legal/global/aup Section 7.

name: Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964
description: US federal statute (42 U.S.C. §2000e) prohibiting employment discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, and national origin. Applies to employers with 15+ employees. Rackspace employs approximately 9,600 people (10-K FY2024) with confirmed EEO commitments and 100% HRC Corporate Equality Index score. Source: 42 U.S.C. §2000e, 10-K FY2024 employee count, 2021 ESG Report.

name: Americans with Disabilities Act / Section 508 Rehabilitation Act
description: US federal statutes (42 U.S.C. §12101 / 29 U.S.C. §794d) prohibiting disability discrimination and requiring accessible electronic and information technology for federal agencies and their contractors. ADA Title III applies to public accommodations including websites. Section 508 applies to Rackspace Government Solutions as federal contractor. Source: ADA 1990, Rehabilitation Act Section 508, FedRAMP authorization.

name: Occupational Safety and Health Act (OSHA General Duty Clause)
description: US federal statute (29 U.S.C. §654) requiring employers to furnish employment free from recognized hazards causing or likely to cause death or serious physical harm. General Duty Clause applies to all Rackspace US facilities including data centers with electrical, mechanical, and environmental hazards. Source: 29 U.S.C. §654(a)(1), Rackspace US site operations.

name: US Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (FASB ASC)
description: FASB Accounting Standards Codification governing financial reporting for US public companies. Rackspace applies ASC 606 (Revenue from Contracts with Customers) for multi-element service arrangements, ASC 842 (Leases), ASC 350 (Goodwill/Intangibles), and ASC 718 (Stock Compensation). SEC requires GAAP-compliant financial statements in 10-K/10-Q filings. Source: 10-K FY2024 Notes to Financial Statements, FASB ASC.

name: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform Act Section 1502 (Conflict Minerals)
description: US federal statute requiring SEC registrants to disclose use of conflict minerals (tin, tantalum, tungsten, gold) originating from DRC or adjoining countries. Annual Form SD filing and Conflict Minerals Report required. Rackspace ESG report references supplier engagement on conflict minerals standards. Source: Dodd-Frank Act §1502, 17 CFR 240.13p-1, rackspace.com/about/responsibility.

name: CAN-SPAM Act
description: US federal statute (15 U.S.C. §7701) establishing requirements for commercial email messages including opt-out mechanisms, accurate header information, physical address inclusion, and prohibitions on deceptive subject lines. FTC enforcement with penalties up to $50,120 per violation. Rackspace AUP Section 4 incorporates email marketing compliance requirements including affirmative consent and opt-out honoring. Source: 15 U.S.C. §7701 et seq., rackspace.com/en-nl/information/legal/global/aup Section 4.

name: Lanham Act (Trademark Act of 1946)
description: US federal trademark statute (15 U.S.C. §1051 et seq.) governing registration, protection, and enforcement of trademarks and service marks. Rackspace maintains registered trademarks including Rackspace®, Rackspace Technology®, and Fanatical Experience®. Published trademark notice at rackspace.com/information/legal. Source: 15 U.S.C. §1051, rackspace.com/information/legal (Copyright and Trademarks page).

name: UK Finance Act 2016 Schedule 19 (Tax Strategy Publication)
description: UK statute requiring qualifying groups and companies to publish their tax strategy annually. Rackspace publishes UK Tax Strategy (156.4 KB PDF) on ir.rackspace.com as required. Applies to UK entities meeting revenue/balance sheet thresholds. Source: Finance Act 2016 Sch 19, ir.rackspace.com/corporate-governance/documents-and-charters.
